edu.csus.plugin.securecodingassistant.compilation

Class InsecureCodeSegment

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csus.plugin.securecodingassistant.compilation.InsecureCodeSegment

  • public class InsecureCodeSegment
extends Object
    Represents a segment of source code that is potentially insecure. Insecure code segments are identified in SecureCompilationParticipant and added to a collection for tracking. An InsecureCodeSegment keeps track of the rule that was violated and also handles adding an IMarker in the development environment to alert the user.
    Author:
    Ben White
    See Also:
    SecureCompilationParticipant, IRule

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The node in the abstract syntax tree where the code is located
      private IResource m_resource
      The underlying resource where the InsecureCodeSegment occurs.
      private IRule m_ruleViolated
      The rule that was violated in this segment of code

        Create new insecure code segment at given node that violates an IRule.
        Parameters:
        node - The AST node where the IRule was violated
        rule - The IRule that was violated
        context - The ReconcileContext, this is needed to create an IMarker at the code location
